natural problem:
Find the sum of all the roots of
\[\frac{x^2 - 13x + 22}{x^2 - 8x + 12} = 0.\]
natural solution: The numerator and denominator factor as \[\frac{(x - 2)(x - 11)}{(x - 2)(x - 6)} = 0.\]For $x = 2,$ the expression is undefined, so the only root is $x = \boxed{11}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. Q x \<noteq> 0 \<longrightarrow> P x / Q x = 0"
shows  "sum_list (roots P) = 11"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the sum of all the roots of
\[\frac{x^2 - 13x + 22}{x^2 - 8x + 12} = 0.\] The final Answer is 11
 ### Proof
 The numerator and denominator factor as \[\frac{(x - 2)(x - 11)}{(x - 2)(x - 6)} = 0.\]For $x = 2,$ the expression is undefined, so the only root is $x = \boxed{11}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. Q x \<noteq> 0 \<longrightarrow> P x / Q x = 0"
shows  "sum_list (roots P) = 11"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $P(x) = x^2 - 13x + 22$ and $Q(x) = x^2 - 8x + 12$, with $Q(x) \neq 0$, and the ratio of $P(x)$ to $Q(x)$ is 0, what is the sum of the roots of $P(x)$? The final answer is $11$.

and h2 : "Q x \<noteq> 0"
and h3 : "P x / Q x = 0"
shows  "sum roots P = 11"

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "P x = 0"
and h3 : "Q x \<noteq> 0"
shows  "sum_list (roots_of P) = 11"

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "f x = 0"
and h3 : "g x \<noteq> 0"
and h4 : "\<forall> x. f x / g x = 0"
shows  "sum_roots f = 11"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem

\[\frac{x^2 - 13x + 22}{x^2 - 8x + 12} = 0.\] The final Answer is 11
 ### Proof
 The numerator and denominator factor as \[\frac{(x - 2)(x - 11)}{(x - 2)(x - 6)} = 0.\]For $x = 2,$ the expression is undefined, so the only root is $x = \boxed{11}.$
 *)

fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "f x = 0"
and h3 : "g x \<noteq> 0"
and h4 : "\<forall> x. f x / g x = 0"
shows  "sum_roots f = 11"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Find the sum of the roots of the quadratic function $f(x) = x^2 - 13x + 22$, given that it does not equal to the quadratic function $g(x) = x^2 - 8x + 12$ at any value of $x$, and the quotient of $f(x)$ over $g(x)$ equals to zero. The final answer is 11.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 2 - 13 * x + 22"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "P x / Q x = 0"
and h3 : "\<exists> a b. (a::real) \<noteq> 0 \<and> (b::real) \<noteq> 0 \<and> P a = 0 \<and> P b = 0"
shows  "(SOME a. P a = 0) + (SOME b. P b = 0) = 11"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem

\[\frac{x^2 - 13x + 22}{x^2 - 8x + 12} = 0.\] The final Answer is 11
 ### Proof

 *)

and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 2 - 8 * x + 12"
and h2 : "P x / Q x = 0"
and h3 : "\<exists> a b. (a::real) \<noteq> 0 \<and> (b::real) \<noteq> 0 \<and> P a = 0 \<and> P b = 0"
shows  "(SOME a. P a = 0) + (SOME b. P b = 0) = 11"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Given two quadratic functions $P(x) = x^2 - 13x + 22$ and $Q(x) = x^2 - 8x + 12$, find the sum of the roots of $P(x)$ when $P(x) / Q(x) = 0$. The final answer is $11$.
